pageContext.surface: smooth.  very slightly encrusted.  light soil adheres
pageContext.other: Detailed, 6-part, hand-drawn illustration, including dimensions and cross-sections.  3 of parts appear to have been added later, as they are in a very different style and drawn on white labels., Line regarding British Museum under COLLECTION is in darker ink, First 3 lines of Info under SITE are written in different handwriting and ink on top of a white-out label.
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT ,  followed by the notation in pencil ,  U  I I   2, below which appears in ink,  July 1923
pageContext.collection: (In possession of,  Wandsworth, Wimbledon & E. D.  Gas Co.), British Museum.  1928.  1-20.3.
pageContext.site: GREATER LONDON, Wandsworth,  Gas Works,  Works of the Wasndworth, Wimbledon & Epsom Dist. Gas Co., 150 yards south of Thames. formerly known as Church Walk & Warple Road., 6 feet from present. 2 feet from original surface., 11 April 1923
pageContext.remarks: BOTTOM LEFT CORNER, IN PENCIL:, Almost OK, BOTTOM RIGHT CORNER, IN PENCIL, C 1,  ,
